title: Sophie Gets Around Paris
description: Sophie learns to navigate Paris! Master how to ask for and give directions, use public transportation, and find your way around the city.
objectives: Use the metro and bus system
Talk about distances and travel time

episodes.title: Lost in the Metro
episodes.content:
Sophie: Excusez-moi, monsieur. Comment aller à la tour Eiffel, s'il vous plaît?

Passager: Ah, la tour Eiffel! Vous devez prendre la ligne 6, direction Nation.

Sophie: La ligne 6... D'accord. Je la prends où?

Passager: Ici, à la station Montparnasse-Bienvenüe. Vous descendez à Bir-Hakeim.

Sophie: Bir-Hakeim. C'est combien de stations?

Passager: C'est... attendez... cinq ou six stations. Environ dix minutes.

Sophie: Parfait, merci! Et après, je sors où?

Passager: À la sortie, tournez à droite. Vous verrez la tour Eiffel, elle est juste là! Impossible de la manquer.

Sophie: Merci beaucoup, vous êtes très gentil!

Passager: De rien! Bonne visite!

[Dans le métro avec Thomas plus tard]

Thomas: Alors Sophie, tu t'habitues au métro parisien?

Sophie: Oui, petit à petit! Mais c'est compliqué au début. Il y a beaucoup de lignes!

Thomas: C'est vrai. Mais tu vas voir, dans quelques semaines, ce sera automatique!

Sophie: J'espère! C'est quelle station pour aller au Louvre?

Thomas: Pour le Louvre, tu prends la ligne 1 jusqu'à Palais Royal - Musée du Louvre. C'est direct d'ici.

Sophie: Super! Et pour aller au Sacré-Cœur?

Thomas: Ah, le Sacré-Cœur... Tu dois prendre la ligne 12 jusqu'à Abbesses, puis tu marches un peu. Ou tu peux prendre le funiculaire!

Sophie: Le funiculaire? Qu'est-ce que c'est?

Thomas: C'est comme un petit train qui monte la colline de Montmartre. C'est pratique parce que c'est très haut!

Sophie: Ah d'accord! J'adore le métro parisien maintenant. C'est tellement pratique!

Thomas: Attends de voir aux heures de pointe! C'est moins romantique.

Sophie: Ha ha! Je crois que j'ai déjà vu ça ce matin!

speakers.name: Sophie
speakers.description: An American woman learning the metro system

episodes.audioStyle: A helpful exchange about metro directions. The passenger is friendly and clear. Later, Thomas is casual and encouraging, sharing practical tips about getting around Paris.

exercise.title: Comprehension: Which line?
exercise.instructions: Which metro line should Sophie take to the Eiffel Tower?

question.content: Which metro line goes to the Eiffel Tower?

content.explanation: The passenger says: 'Vous devez prendre la ligne 6' - You must take line 6.
content.hint: Listen for 'la ligne' followed by a number.

exercise.title: Comprehension: Where to get off?
exercise.instructions: At which station should Sophie get off for the Eiffel Tower?

question.content: What is the station for the Eiffel Tower?

content.explanation: The passenger says: 'Vous descendez à Bir-Hakeim' - You get off at Bir-Hakeim.

exercise.title: Match Direction Vocabulary
exercise.instructions: Match the French direction words with their English meanings.

content.hint: These are essential words for getting directions.

exercise.title: Match Transportation Terms
exercise.instructions: Match the French transportation terms with English.

content.hint: These words are used when talking about the metro.

exercise.title: Complete: How to get to...?
exercise.instructions: Complete the question asking for directions.

content.text: Comment _____ à la tour Eiffel, s'il vous plaît ?
content.translation: How do I get to the Eiffel Tower, please?
content.hint: Use the infinitive form of the verb 'to go'.

exercise.title: Arrange: You must take...
exercise.instructions: Put the words in the correct order.

content.explanation: 'Devoir' means 'must/have to'. 'Prendre' means 'to take'. Structure: subject + devoir + infinitive verb.

content.hint: This word asks about quantity or amount.

exercise.title: Comprehension: Travel time
exercise.instructions: How long does it take to get to the Eiffel Tower?

question.content: How long is the metro ride to Bir-Hakeim?

content.explanation: The passenger says: 'Environ dix minutes' - About ten minutes.

exercise.title: Navigating the Paris Metro
exercise.instructions: Complete the summary about Sophie learning the metro.

content.text: Sophie asks a passenger how to get to the {blank1} Tower. He tells her to take line {blank2} toward Nation and get off at {blank3}. It takes about {blank4} minutes and is 5-6 stations away. After exiting, she should turn {blank5}. Later, Thomas explains that to go to the Louvre, she takes line {blank6} to Palais Royal. For Sacré-Cœur, she can take line 12 to {blank7} or use the {blank8}. Sophie is getting used to the Paris metro, though Thomas warns her about {blank9} hour!
content.hint: Review both conversations for metro directions and tips.

question.content: When Sophie says 'Oui, petit à petit!', what does she mean?

content.explanation: 'Petit à petit' is an expression meaning 'little by little' or 'gradually'. Sophie is saying she's getting used to the metro gradually.
content.hint: It's a positive expression about gradual progress.

episodes.title: Finding the Office
episodes.content:
On her second week in Paris, Sophie decided to walk to work instead of taking the metro. It was a beautiful morning, and she wanted to explore her neighborhood.

She left her apartment building and turned right onto rue Daguerre. "Je tourne à droite," she said to herself, practicing her French. At the end of the street, she saw a boulangerie - a bakery. The smell of fresh bread was irresistible.

"Bonjour!" said the baker. "Un croissant, s'il vous plaît," Sophie ordered, proud of how natural it sounded now.

With her warm croissant in hand, she continued her walk. According to her phone's map, she needed to walk straight for about ten minutes, then turn left at the big intersection.

As she walked, she passed a small park on her left. "Le parc est à gauche," she noted. Some elderly people were sitting on benches, enjoying the morning sun. Children were playing near a fountain.

Sophie continued straight ahead - tout droit - along the Boulevard du Montparnasse. She passed cafés where people sat outside drinking coffee and reading newspapers. This was the Paris she had dreamed about!

At the intersection, she turned left as planned. "Je tourne à gauche," she practiced again. Now she was on Avenue du Maine, getting closer to her office.

Suddenly, she realized she wasn't sure which building was hers. She stopped an older woman walking her dog.

"Excusez-moi, madame. Où se trouve le numéro 52, s'il vous plaît?"

The woman smiled. "Le 52? C'est juste là, mademoiselle. L'immeuble moderne avec les fenêtres bleues."

"Ah oui! Merci beaucoup, madame!"

"De rien. Bonne journée!"

Sophie found her building easily after that. It was the modern building with blue windows, just as the woman had described. She had done it - she had walked to work, ordered in French, asked for directions, and found her way! 

As she entered the building, Thomas was just arriving too.

"Sophie! Tu as marché? You walked?"

"Oui! C'est plus agréable que le métro!"

"Bravo! Tu deviens une vraie Parisienne!" Thomas said with a proud smile.

Sophie beamed. A real Parisian! That was the best compliment she could have received.

exercise.title: Comprehension: First Direction
exercise.instructions: Which way did Sophie turn leaving her building?

question.content: What direction did Sophie turn when leaving her apartment?

content.explanation: The story says: 'She left her apartment building and turned right onto rue Daguerre.'
content.hint: The direction Sophie turns onto rue Daguerre.

exercise.title: Comprehension: What did Sophie buy?
exercise.instructions: What did Sophie purchase at the bakery?

question.content: What did Sophie buy at the boulangerie?

content.explanation: Sophie ordered: 'Un croissant, s'il vous plaît' - One croissant, please.

exercise.title: Match Location Prepositions
exercise.instructions: Match the French prepositions with their English meanings.

content.hint: These prepositions help describe where things are located.

exercise.title: Complete: Where is located?
exercise.instructions: Complete the question asking for a location.

content.text: Où se _____ le numéro 52, s'il vous plaît ?

exercise.title: Arrange: The park is on the left
exercise.instructions: Put the words in the correct order.

content.translation: The park is on the left
content.explanation: To describe location, use: [subject] + être + à gauche/à droite/tout droit/près de, etc.

exercise.title: Comprehension: Building description
exercise.instructions: How was Sophie's office building described?

question.content: What feature identifies Sophie's office building?

content.explanation: The woman says: 'L'immeuble moderne avec les fenêtres bleues' - The modern building with blue windows.
content.hint: The building is modern with a specific colored feature.
The feminine form of someone from Paris.

exercise.title: Sophie's Walk to Work
exercise.instructions: Complete the summary of Sophie's morning walk.

content.text: Sophie decides to {blank1} to work instead of taking the metro. She leaves her apartment and turns {blank2} onto rue Daguerre. She stops at a {blank3} and buys a {blank4}. She walks {blank5} along Boulevard du Montparnasse, passing a park on her {blank6}. At the intersection, she turns {blank7}. When she's unsure which building is hers, she asks a woman with a {blank8}. The woman points to the modern building with {blank9} windows. Thomas congratulates Sophie, saying she's becoming a real {blank10}!
content.hint: Follow Sophie's journey step by step through the story.

question.content: When Sophie says 'C'est plus agréable que le métro', what does she mean?

options.text: It's more pleasant than the metro
It's the same as the metro
It's less pleasant than the metro

content.explanation: 'Plus agréable que' means 'more pleasant than'. Sophie is saying walking is more pleasant than taking the metro.

speakers.name: Narrator
speakers.description: Story narrator with warm, engaging voice

episodes.audioStyle: This is a narrative story with a warm, calm tone. The narrator reads with natural pacing, creating an immersive storytelling experience.
